body:
I have just noticed that I have been temporarily banned from Avicus for 24 hours. Reason being, Accusing others of "hacking". Lets rewind here. Now, we typically think of "Accusing" others of hacking is some [Removed] year old who hasn't played the game properly yet to know what hacking is, So if he were to notice someone better than him, he would never second think him self and give the other player a chance, he would automatically think the other player is "hacking" because he is better than him. I am not saying that the typical [Removed] year old playing would act like that nor trying to discount their credibility from writing this, there are sometimes hackers out there and sometimes are caught by the eye's of players, but normally should not equal a automatic statement from players to shout in chat, curse, or use aggressive language for what they had seen or experienced. Anyway I was playing a nebula map on Luar i believe so, and I had noticed a player that shall not be named, had quite a quick reaction time when it came to hitting players when he/she encountered them. At first i had just discredited this to be probably my ping being high or just a bad response time with my ISP (Internet Service Provider). I later encountered the player after he had fallen from a great height (5 blocks in the sky) and had some wood is their had and without even turning their head to look i was there, the player immediately started to hit me. As i tried to come closer to get the kill i was just hit farther and farther away from them, until they realized they were fighting me and had took their sword out to kill me. This frustrated me greatly and i had given them a chance, blew off my first gut feeling about them, but they later confirmed it and i had almost nothing to say but what i had said to the public chat for people to type the command /report (player's name) quickly after i had some people confirm my thoughts about the suspected hacker. I was automatically given a warning by Avicus's system about not saying in chat to /report players. I acknowledged that warning and continued playing. Funny thing, Next game a "Manager"(basically a administrator) and a "Jr Mod" had suddenly popped in and the "Manager" had started out of no where interrogating the the person who I had last game accused of "hacking". I had stated to the Manager that the previous game the player he was accusing was someone who had also been using Kill Aura, The manager had responded saying that he can confirm the accused hacker had or has been using Kill Aura and now the Manager is accusing the player of hacking. Little did i know i apparently had players in the game who did not appreciate my remarks about the player in question and my statements about him, and had decided it would be alright to start harassing me in chat, accusing me of hacking and other little things, i shook it off and continued playing. a bit later i decided to come back on to play a quick game of nebula when I discovered this: 
(image provided in link) http://imgur.com/NQTFrAT   
                                                                                 
I will leave you guys to that, comment down below of what you think about this and i will be happy to respond to any questions asked.
                                                     
~Thank you.   

*I will not be applying for a ban appeal, I had not followed Avicus rules and strict protocol's and accept full responsibility for my actions*

replies.body: I'm sorry I can't be on your side, but to be honest, I think this is a good punishment. I know if can be really frustrating to play Nebula sometimes, even without a hacker, so if you do run into a hacker you might start raging. Although this is true, you have to have self-control. You know that it's against the rules to call hacks in chat and to persuade players to /report. I'm sure other people saw that person, too, and reported them. Also, I don't think anyone would /report someone with no evidence after hearing it from some random person. Also, if the hacker saw what you said, (s)he could turn his/her hacks off or leave and mods couldn't ban him/her. Then, the hacker could come back later and continue hacking. I really like the change of how mods are strict about this because if you want someone to get banned, this is the last thing you'd want to do. I know it might be hard, but just try not to say anything next time :3
